description: Returns a list of Explainability resources created using the  CreateExplainability operation. This operation returns a summary for each Explainability. You can filter the list using an array of  Filter objects. To retrieve the complete set of properties for a particular Explainability resource, use the ARN with the  DescribeExplainability operation.

parameters.name: Filters
parameters.description: An array of filters. For each filter, provide a condition and a match statement. The condition is either IS or IS_NOT, which specifies whether to include or exclude the resources that match the statement from the list. The match statement consists of a key and a value. Condition - The condition to apply. Valid values are IS and IS_NOT. Key - The name of the parameter to filter on. Valid values are ResourceArn and Status. Value - The value to match. (dict) --- Describes a filter for choosing a subset of objects. Each filter consists of a condition and a match statement. The condition is either IS or IS_NOT, which specifies whether to include or exclude the objects that match the statement, respectively. The name of the parameter to filter on. The value to match. The condition to apply. To include the objects that match the statement, specify IS. To exclude matching objects, specify IS_NOT.

nested_items.name: Explainabilities
nested_items.description: An array of objects that summarize the properties of each Explainability resource.

nested_items.name: ExplainabilityArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Explainability.

nested_items.name: ExplainabilityName
nested_items.description: The name of the Explainability.

nested_items.name: ResourceArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Predictor or Forecast used to create the Explainability.

nested_items.name: ExplainabilityConfig
nested_items.description: The configuration settings that define the granularity of time series and time points for the Explainability.

nested_items.name: TimeSeriesGranularity
nested_items.description: To create an Explainability for all time series in your datasets, use ALL. To create an Explainability for specific time series in your datasets, use SPECIFIC.

nested_items.name: TimePointGranularity
nested_items.description: To create an Explainability for all time points in your forecast horizon, use ALL. To create an Explainability for specific time points in your forecast horizon, use SPECIFIC.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status of the Explainability. States include:
ACTIVE.
CREATE_PENDING, CREATE_IN_PROGRESS, CREATE_FAILED.
CREATE_STOPPING, CREATE_STOPPED.
DELETE_PENDING, DELETE_IN_PROGRESS, DELETE_FAILED.

nested_items.name: Message
nested_items.description: Information about any errors that may have occurred during the Explainability creation process.

nested_items.name: CreationTime
nested_items.description: When the Explainability was created.

nested_items.name: LastModificationTime
nested_items.description: The last time the resource was modified. The timestamp depends on the status of the job:
CREATE_PENDING - The CreationTime.
CREATE_IN_PROGRESS - The current timestamp.
CREATE_STOPPING - The current timestamp.
CREATE_STOPPED - When the job stopped.
ACTIVE or CREATE_FAILED - When the job finished or failed.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: Returns this token if the response is truncated. To retrieve the next set of results, use the token in the next request.
